required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Etanercept on Nail Psoriasis and Plaque Psoriasis
clinical_study.official_title: Randomised, Open-label Preliminary Study to Assess the Effects of 2 Regimens of Etanercept on Nail and Skin Symptoms in Patients With Nail Psoriasis and Plaque Psoriasis

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate if Etanercept administered at a higher initial dose provides greater improvement in nail and skin psoriasis symptoms than a regimen with a lower initial dose.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will assess the effects of the 2 Etanercept regimens on fingernail psoriasis over 24 weeks among patients with both skin and fingernail symptoms who have previously failed at least one therapy for nail psoriasis. The endpoint of 24 weeks was chosen to allow sufficient time for normal nail growth.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Nail Psoriasis Severity Index (NAPSI) Score for Target Fingernail
primary_outcome.description: Target fingernail (highest matrix + bed scores at baseline) divided with imaginary lines into quadrants and graded for nail matrix and nail bed psoriasis. Sum of scores = total score for that nail (0-8). Nail Matrix Psoriasis = pitting, leukonychia, red spots in lunula, and/or nail plate crumbling. Nail Bed Psoriasis = onycholysis, splinter hemorrhages, oil drop (salmon patch) discoloration, and/or nail bed hyperkeratosis. Range for both scores: 0 (none), 1 (present in 1/4 nail), 2 (present in 2/4 nail), 3 (present in 3/4 nail), 4 (present in 4/4 nail). Higher scores = more severe psoriasis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Overall Nail Psoriasis Severity Index (NAPSI) Score
secondary_outcome.description: NAPSI (matrix + bed score) performed on dorsal views of 8 fingers, excluding thumb; range: 0 to 8. Overall NAPSI score = sum of all fingernail scores; range: 0 to 64. Nails were divided into quadrants and graded for nail matrix and bed psoriasis. Nail Matrix Psoriasis = pitting, leukonychia, red spots in lunula, and/or nail plate crumbling. Nail Bed Psoriasis = onycholysis, splinter hemorrhages, oil drop (salmon patch) discoloration, and/or nail bed hyperkeratosis. Range for both scores: 0 (none), 1 (present 1/4 nail), 2 (present 2/4 nail), 3 (present 3/4 nail), and 4 (present 4/4 nail).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants Who Achieved a 50% Improvement in the Nail Psoriasis Severity Index (NAPSI) Score for Target Fingernail at Week 12 and Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Target fingernail (highest matrix + bed scores at baseline) divided with imaginary lines into quadrants and graded for nail matrix and nail bed psoriasis. Sum of scores = total score for that nail (0-8). Nail Matrix Psoriasis = pitting, leukonychia, red spots in lunula, and/or nail plate crumbling. Nail Bed Psoriasis = onycholysis, splinter hemorrhages, oil drop (salmon patch) discoloration, and/or nail bed hyperkeratosis. Range for both scores 0-8: 0 (none), 1 (present in 1/4 nail), 2 (present in 2/4 nail), 3 (present in 3/4 nail),4 (present in 4/4 nail). Higher score = more severe psoriasis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants Who Achieved a 75% Improvement in the Nail Psoriasis Severity Index (NAPSI) Score for Target Fingernail at Week 12 and Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Target fingernail (highest matrix + bed scores at baseline) divided with imaginary lines into quadrants and graded for nail matrix and nail bed psoriasis. Sum of scores = total score for that nail (0-8). Nail Matrix Psoriasis = pitting, leukonychia, red spots in lunula, and/or nail plate crumbling. Nail Bed Psoriasis = onycholysis, splinter hemorrhages, oil drop (salmon patch) discoloration, and/or nail bed hyperkeratosis. Range for both scores: 0 (none), 1 (present in 1/4 nail), 2 (present in 2/4 nail), 3 (present in 3/4 nail), 4 (present in 4/4 nail). Higher scores = more severe psoriasis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants Who Achieved a 50% Improvement in the Nail Psoriasis Severity Index (NAPSI) for Overall NAPSI Score at Week 12 and Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: NAPSI (matrix + bed score) performed on dorsal views of 8 fingers, excluding thumb; range: 0 to 8. Overall NAPSI score = sum of all fingernail scores; range: 0 to 64. Nails were divided into quadrants and graded for nail matrix and bed psoriasis. Nail Matrix Psoriasis = pitting, leukonychia, red spots in lunula, and/or nail plate crumbling. Nail Bed Psoriasis = onycholysis, splinter hemorrhages, oil drop (salmon patch) discoloration, and/or nail bed hyperkeratosis. Range for both scores: 0 (none), 1 (present 1/4 nail), 2 (present 2/4 nail), 3 (present 3/4 nail), and 4 (present 4/4 nail).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants Who Achieved a 75% Improvement in the Nail Psoriasis Severity Index (NAPSI) for Overall NAPSI Score at Week 12 and Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: NAPSI (matrix + bed score) performed on dorsal views of 8 fingers, excluding thumb; range: 0 to 8. Overall NAPSI score = sum of all fingernail scores; range: 0 to 64. Nails were divided into quadrants and graded for nail matrix and bed psoriasis. Nail Matrix Psoriasis = pitting, leukonychia, red spots in lunula, and/or nail plate crumbling. Nail Bed Psoriasis = onycholysis, splinter hemorrhages, oil drop (salmon patch) discoloration, and/or nail bed hyperkeratosis. Range for both scores: 0 (none), 1 (present 1/4 nail), 2 (present 2/4 nail), 3 (present 3/4 nail), and 4 (present 4/4 nail).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Combined assessment of lesion severity and area affected into single score; range: 0 (no disease) to 72 (maximal disease). Body was divided into 4 sections (head, arms, trunk, legs); each area was scored by itself and scores were combined for final PASI. For each section percent (%) area of skin involved was estimated: 0 (0%) to 6 (90 - 100%), and severity was estimated by clinical signs: erythema, induration, and desquamation; scale: 0 (none) to 4 (maximum). Final PASI = sum of severity parameters for each section * area score * weight of section (head: 0.1, arms: 0.2, body: 0.3, legs: 0.4).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants Achieving a 50% Improvement in the Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI) Score at Week 12 and Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Combined assessment of lesion severity and area affected into single score; range: 0 (no disease) to 72 (maximal disease). Body was divided into 4 sections (head, arms, trunk, legs); each area was scored by itself and scores were combined for final PASI. For each section percent (%) area of skin involved was estimated: 0 (0%) to 6 (90 - 100%), and severity was estimated by clinical signs: erythema, induration, and desquamation; scale: 0 (none) to 4 (maximum). Final PASI = sum of severity parameters for each section * area score * weight of section (head: 0.1, arms: 0.2, body: 0.3, legs: 0.4).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants Achieving a 75% Improvement in the Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI) Score at Week 12 and Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Combined assessment of lesion severity and area affected into single score; range: 0 (no disease) to 72 (maximal disease). Body was divided into 4 sections (head, arms, trunk, legs); each area was scored by itself and scores were combined for final PASI. For each section percent (%) area of skin involved was estimated: 0 (0%) to 6 (90 - 100%), and severity was estimated by clinical signs: erythema, induration, and desquamation; scale: 0 (none) to 4 (maximum). Final PASI = sum of severity parameters for each section * area score * weight of section (head: 0.1, arms: 0.2, body: 0.3, legs: 0.4).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis
secondary_outcome.description: Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis: score based on dermatologist's assessment of disease averaged over all lesions of head, scalp, and neck. Overall lesions were graded for induration, erythema, and scaling; range: 0 (no evidence) to 5 (severe). The sum of the 3 scores was divided by 3 to obtain a final PGA score. Higher scores indicate greater severity of disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants Achieving a Status on the Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis of Clear or Almost Clear
secondary_outcome.description: Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis: score based on dermatologist's assessment of disease averaged over all lesions of head, scalp, and neck. Overall lesions were graded for induration, erythema, and scaling; range: 0 (no evidence) to 5 (severe). The sum of the 3 scores was divided by 3 to obtain a final PGA score. Higher scores indicate greater severity of disease. Assessment of clear or almost clear = PGA score of 0 (no evidence), or 1 (minimal/faint).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants Achieving a Status on the Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis of Mild or Better
secondary_outcome.description: Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis: score based on dermatologist's assessment of disease averaged over all lesions of head, scalp, and neck. Overall lesions were graded for induration, erythema, and scaling; range: 0 (no evidence) to 5 (severe). The sum of the 3 scores was divided by 3 to obtain a final PGA score. Higher scores indicate greater severity of disease. Assessment of mild or better = PGA score of ≤ 2 (mild plaque elevation, mild scaling, and light red coloration).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-administered questionnaire to measure health-related quality of life (QoL)of adult patients suffering from skin disease; 10 questions concerning patients' perception of impact of their disease over last week encompassing aspects such as symptoms, feelings, daily activities, leisure, work, school, personal relationships and side effects of treatment. Questions scored on a 4-point Likert scale: 0 (not at all/not relevant), 1 (a little), 2 (a lot), and 3 (very much). Scores of individual items (0-3) were added to yield a total score (0-30); higher score = greater impairment of patient's QoL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Physician Assessment of Nail Psoriasis Activity Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Physician global assessment of disease activity using a visual analog scale; range: 0 (no nail disease) to 100 (worst possible nail disease).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Patient Assessment of Nail Psoriasis Activity Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Patient global assessment of disease activity using a visual analog scale; range: 0 (no nail disease) to 100 (worst possible nail disease).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Physician Fingernail Grading Assessment Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: Physician assessment of disease activity for each fingernail; range: 0 (no disease), 1 (mild disease, 2 (moderate disease), or 3 (severe disease). Total score range = 0-30.

arm_group.description: etanercept 50 mg SC injection twice weekly for 12 weeks reducing to etanercept 50 mg once weekly to week 24
etanercept 50 mg SC once weekly for the complete 24 week treatment period

intervention.description: Subjects randomized to Arm 1 shall be treated with ETN 50 mg twice weekly for 12 weeks reducing thereafter to ETN 50 mg once weekly to 24 weeks. Subjects randomized to Arm 2 shall be treated with ETN 50 mg once weekly for the entire 24 week treatment period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years of age or older
- Active, stable plaque psoriasis defined by the following criteria:
- Body surface area (BSA) ≥ 10 % at screening and baseline
- Or, PASI >10 at screening and baseline
- Or, PGA of Psoriasis status of moderate or worse (moderate, marked, or severe) at screening and baseline
- Or, DLQI > 10 at baseline
- Active fingernail psoriasis defined as target fingernail NAPSI ≥ 2 and overall NAPSI > 14 - Target nail is defined as the nail with the highest nail score (matrix+bed scores) at baseline. Should more than one fingernail have the same score, the target fingernail will be chosen by the investigator.
- Failure of at least one systemic psoriasis therapy for nail psoriasis
- Eligible to receive biologic therapy for psoriasis in accordance to local guidelines
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of Skin conditions other than psoriasis
- Psoralen plus ultraviolet radiation (PUVA), cyclosporine, alefacept, methotrexate, acitretin, or any other systemic anti-psoriasis therapy within 28 days of study drug initiation
- Prior exposure to any TNF-inhibitor. Prior exposure to efalizumab

overall_official.affiliation: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Eighty-five participants were screened for the study; 13 participants were screening failures, and 72 participants were randomized to treatment.

group.title: Etanercept: Twice, Then Once Weekly
group.description: Etanercept 50 mg subcutaneous (SC) injection twice weekly for 12 weeks reduced to Etanercept 50 mg once weekly to week 24

group.title: Etanercept: Once Weekly
group.description: Etanercept 50 mg SC once weekly for the complete 24 week treatment period

participants_list.participants: At least one dose of study medication, and had baseline and post-baseline data.
At least one dose of study medication, and had baseline and post-baseline data.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Nail Psoriasis Severity Index (NAPSI) Score for Target Fingernail
outcome.description: Target fingernail (highest matrix + bed scores at baseline) divided with imaginary lines into quadrants and graded for nail matrix and nail bed psoriasis. Sum of scores = total score for that nail (0-8). Nail Matrix Psoriasis = pitting, leukonychia, red spots in lunula, and/or nail plate crumbling. Nail Bed Psoriasis = onycholysis, splinter hemorrhages, oil drop (salmon patch) discoloration, and/or nail bed hyperkeratosis. Range for both scores: 0 (none), 1 (present in 1/4 nail), 2 (present in 2/4 nail), 3 (present in 3/4 nail), 4 (present in 4/4 nail). Higher scores = more severe psoriasis.
outcome.population: Modified Intent-to-Treat (mITT) population: all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study medication, and provided baseline and post-baseline data. N = number of participants with evaluable data.

analysis.method_desc: Adjusted change calculated from mixed-model. Model for change = [Group visit Group*visit baseline baseline*visit].

analysis.p_value_desc: Adjusted change calculated from mixed-model. Model for change = [Group visit Group*visit baseline baseline*visit].

Body was divided into 4 sections (head, arms, trunk, legs); each area was scored by itself and scores were combined for final PASI. For each section percent (%) area of skin involved was estimated: 0 (0%) to 6 (90 – 100%), and severity was estimated by clinical signs: erythema, induration, and desquamation; scale: 0 (none) to 4 (maximum). Final PASI = sum of severity parameters for each section * area score * weight of section (head: 0.1, arms: 0.2, body: 0.3, legs: 0.4).
outcome.population: mITT, N = number of participants with evaluable data.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in the Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI) Score
measure.description: Combined assessment of lesion severity and area affected into single score; range: 0 (no disease) to 72 (maximal disease). Body was divided into 4 sections (head, arms, trunk, legs); each area was scored by itself and scores were combined for final PASI. For each section percent (%) area of skin involved was estimated: 0 (0%) to 6 (90 – 100%), and severity was estimated by clinical signs: erythema, induration, and desquamation; scale: 0 (none) to 4 (maximum). Final PASI = sum of severity parameters for each section * area score * weight of section (head: 0.1, arms: 0.2, body: 0.3, legs: 0.4).
measure.population: mITT, N = number of participants with evaluable data.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis
outcome.description: Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis: score based on dermatologist's assessment of disease averaged over all lesions of head, scalp, and neck. Overall lesions were graded for induration, erythema, and scaling; range: 0 (no evidence) to 5 (severe). The sum of the 3 scores was divided by 3 to obtain a final PGA score. Higher scores indicate greater severity of disease.
outcome.population: mITT, N = number of participants with evaluable data.

group.title: Etanercept: Twice, Then Once Weekly

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis
measure.description: Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis: score based on dermatologist's assessment of disease averaged over all lesions of head, scalp, and neck. Overall lesions were graded for induration, erythema, and scaling; range: 0 (no evidence) to 5 (severe). The sum of the 3 scores was divided by 3 to obtain a final PGA score. Higher scores indicate greater severity of disease.

outcome.title: Percent of Participants Achieving a Status on the Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis of Clear or Almost Clear
outcome.description: Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis: score based on dermatologist's assessment of disease averaged over all lesions of head, scalp, and neck. Overall lesions were graded for induration, erythema, and scaling; range: 0 (no evidence) to 5 (severe). The sum of the 3 scores was divided by 3 to obtain a final PGA score. Higher scores indicate greater severity of disease. Assessment of clear or almost clear = PGA score of 0 (no evidence), or 1 (minimal/faint).
outcome.population: mITT, N = number of participants with evaluable data.

group.title: Etanercept: Twice, Then Once Weekly

measure.title: Percent of Participants Achieving a Status on the Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis of Clear or Almost Clear
measure.description: Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis: score based on dermatologist's assessment of disease averaged over all lesions of head, scalp, and neck. Overall lesions were graded for induration, erythema, and scaling; range: 0 (no evidence) to 5 (severe). The sum of the 3 scores was divided by 3 to obtain a final PGA score. Higher scores indicate greater severity of disease. Assessment of clear or almost clear = PGA score of 0 (no evidence), or 1 (minimal/faint).
measure.population: mITT, N = number of participants with evaluable data.

analysis.p_value_desc: P-value from generalized linear models for correlated data using Generalized Estimating Equations (GEE) with treatment and visits as fixed factors. Model for proportion=[Group visit Group*visit].

outcome.title: Percent of Participants Achieving a Status on the Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis of Mild or Better
outcome.description: Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis: score based on dermatologist's assessment of disease averaged over all lesions of head, scalp, and neck. Overall lesions were graded for induration, erythema, and scaling; range: 0 (no evidence) to 5 (severe). The sum of the 3 scores was divided by 3 to obtain a final PGA score. Higher scores indicate greater severity of disease. Assessment of mild or better = PGA score of ≤ 2 (mild plaque elevation, mild scaling, and light red coloration).
outcome.population: mITT, N = number of participants with evaluable data.

measure.title: Percent of Participants Achieving a Status on the Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis of Mild or Better
measure.description: Physician Global Assessment (PGA) of Psoriasis: score based on dermatologist's assessment of disease averaged over all lesions of head, scalp, and neck. Overall lesions were graded for induration, erythema, and scaling; range: 0 (no evidence) to 5 (severe). The sum of the 3 scores was divided by 3 to obtain a final PGA score. Higher scores indicate greater severity of disease. Assessment of mild or better = PGA score of ≤ 2 (mild plaque elevation, mild scaling, and light red coloration).
measure.population: mITT, N = number of participants with evaluable data.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI)
outcome.description: Self-administered questionnaire to measure health-related quality of life (QoL)of adult patients suffering from skin disease; 10 questions concerning patients' perception of impact of their disease over last week encompassing aspects such as symptoms, feelings, daily activities, leisure, work, school, personal relationships and side effects of treatment. Questions scored on a 4-point Likert scale: 0 (not at all/not relevant), 1 (a little), 2 (a lot), and 3 (very much). Scores of individual items (0-3) were added to yield a total score (0-30); higher score = greater impairment of patient's QoL.
outcome.population: mITT, N = number of participants with evaluable data.

Questions scored on a 4-point Likert scale: 0 (not at all/not relevant), 1 (a little), 2 (a lot), and 3 (very much). Scores of individual items (0-3) were added to yield a total score (0-30); higher score = greater impairment of patient's QoL.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PIs agreed to allow the sponsor 60 days to review and require changes to presentations or publications but only to protect confidential information and intellectual property, and for the sponsor to file a patent application, as applicable. The PIs also agreed for data to be presented first as a joint, multi-center publication.
